page.title: 09CHURCH FARM IN CAPEL
page.content: CHURCH FARM IS AT THE TOP OF CHURCH LANE OPPOSITE ST. THOMAS A BECKET CHURCH. IT HAS 370 ACRES OF LAND - 232 ACRES CULTIVATED AND 138 ACRES OF GRASSLAND. THE BUGGS FAMILY HAVE OWNED IT SINCE 1847 - IT WAS ONCE SEVERAL SMALLER FARMS. CROPS GROWN ARE CORN, HOPS, APPLES AND HAY.APPLES INCLUDE BRAMLEY, GRENADIER, HOWGATE WONDER AND WARNERS KING. THERE ARE 8 HOPGARDENS, 2 YEARS AGO SOME HAD TO BE GRUBBED. PICKING BY HAND STOPPED IN 1961. BULLOCKS ARE FATTENED FOR 2 YEARS BEFORE GOING TO MARKET - THEY EAT HAY AND BARLEY IN THE YARD IN WINTER AND GRASS IN SUMMER. 350 SHEEP ARE KEPT. ALTOGETHER THESE ANIMALS EAT 23 TONS OF BARLEY A WEEK. AT PRESENT 4 FULL TIME FARM WORKERS ARE EMPLOYED AND 1 PART TIME. AT ONE TIME 15 MEN WERE EMPLOYED AND AS MANY WOMEN.
